SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc27
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc27.Model.ClientClass

Interface ClientPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Player
public interface ClientPlayer
The ClientPlayer interface provides methods for accessing player-related data, including player state, pawn colour, manuscript, objectives, username, hand, and starter card.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ArrayList<ResourceCard>
    getHand()
    Gets the player's hand
    Manuscript
    getManuscript()
    Gets the manuscript of the player
    PawnColour
    getPawnColour()
    Gets the pawn colour chosen by the player
    PlayerState
    getPlayerState()
    Gets the current state of the player
    ArrayList<ObjectiveCard>
    getSecretObjectives()
    Gets the secret objective cards chosen by the player
    StarterCard
    getStarterCard()
    Gets the starter card assigned to the player
    String
    getUsername()
    Gets the username of the player

  • Method Details

    • getPlayerState

      PlayerState getPlayerState()
      Gets the current state of the player
      Returns:
      the PlayerState representing the current state of the player.

    • getPawnColour

      PawnColour getPawnColour()
      Gets the pawn colour chosen by the player
      Returns:
      the PawnColour representing the player's pawn colour.

    • getManuscript

      Manuscript getManuscript()
      Gets the manuscript of the player
      Returns:
      the Manuscript

    • getSecretObjectives

      ArrayList<ObjectiveCard> getSecretObjectives()
      Gets the secret objective cards chosen by the player
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ObjectiveCards containing only the player's secret objectives

    • getUsername

      String getUsername()
      Gets the username of the player
      Returns:
      a String representing the player's username.

    • getHand

      ArrayList<ResourceCard> getHand()
      Gets the player's hand
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ResourceCards representing the player's hand.

    • getStarterCard

      StarterCard getStarterCard()
      Gets the starter card assigned to the player
      Returns:
      the StarterCard representing the player's starter card.
